column1: Some causes or risk factors may be: - Infections of the uterus, cervix, or vagina - Too much stretching of the amniotic sac (this may happen if there is too much fluid, or more than one baby putting pressure on the membranes) - Smoking - If you have had surgery or biopsies of the cervix - If you were pregnant before and had a PROM or PPROM Most women whose water breaks before labor do not have a risk factor.
The biggest sign to watch for is fluid leaking from the vagina.
